DOC.brief_summary: to investigate the effectiveness of techniques of either using Magill forceps or cuff inflation in facilitation of nasotracheal tube advancement into trachea
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of Different Tools to Facilitate Nasotracheal Tube Placement Under Video-laryngoscope Use
DOC.detailed_description: Patients who undergo oxo-maxillofacial surgery need naso-tracheal intubation to present good surgical view-field. but, sometimes, the naso-tracheal tube is unable to advance from nasopharynx, oropharynx, into trachea without assistance. Using techniques of either Magill forceps or cuff inflation is advantageous is not determined.
DOC.criteria: 1. patients with American Society of Anesthesiologists physical status IIII 2. aged 2065 years 3. Requiring Nasotracheal Intubation under general anesthesia 4. unlimited mouth open 5. unlimited neck motion 1. mouth open ＜ 3 cm 2. Ankylosing arthritis patients. 3. BMI≧35 kg/m2
